entries.meaning: Having the shape of fan or concertina, with a row of sheets alternately folded backwards and forwards.

verbs.description: fanfold (third-person singular simple present fanfolds, present participle fanfolding, simple past and past participle fanfolded)

examples: When the top sheet, blanket, and bedspread of a closed bed are turned back, or fanfolded, the closed bed becomes an open bed, or a bed ready to receive a patient or resident.
